meanings.definition: To make (someone) feel very happy, animated, or elated.
meanings.sent1: The surprise party will exhilarate her.
meanings.sent2: The thrilling roller coaster ride exhilarated the children.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics never fail to exhilarate us.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful sunset exhilarated her soul.
meanings.sent5: The victory in the game exhilarated the entire team.

meanings.sent1: A brisk walk in the fresh air can exhilarate you.
meanings.sent2: The strong coffee exhilarated his senses in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The energetic music seemed to exhilarate the sleepy cat.
meanings.sent4: The inspiring speech exhilarated the audience to take action.
meanings.sent5: The cool breeze exhilarated her tired mind after a long day.
